intro: Tracaulon hastatotrilobum, commonly known as the three-lobed tracaulon, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its intricate leaf structure. Its leaves are tri-lobed, with each lobe exhibiting a distinct, wavy margin that contributes to its ornamental appeal. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the late spring and early summer. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically found in temperate rainforests. Due to its limited geographic range and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
